result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry A. Drover was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
Consecutive to: any other sentence currently being served.

miscConds.notes: Bond not applied to Case No. 14CF11 in the amount of $552 has been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to comply with any and all mental health treatment as prescribed by treating mental health care professionals.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: from the Dept of Veterans Affairs given to the Court by Atty Castonia at the 1/21/2015 Plea/sentencing hearing

14CF11 & 14CF193 Cases called @ 1:48 p.m. Defendant Terry A. Drover in court with attorney Rebecca C. Castonia.  Defendant Terry A. Drover in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Global agreement recited by DA Blader. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing in 14CF193. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed by DA Blader. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:14CF11: Ct 1- NC. 14CF193: Cts 2 & 3 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 14CF11: Ct 2 - Dismissed outright. Ct 3 - DRI. 14CF193: Cts 1 & 4 - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Castonia. Statement by DE. Court orders: 14CF11 - S/W 3 years probation - Conditions: 12 mos WCJ - Huber, GT, 97 days CFTS - Sentence to commence forthwith, $1500 fine inclusive of costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, 36 month DL rev/36 month IID effective today, OWI Assessment, defendant to comply with any and all treatment prescribed by the defendant's treating mental health care professionals, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, AODA and follow through. Bond previously posted to be applied. 
14CF193 - Ct 2 -  1 year WCJ consecutive to any other sentence currently being served - Huber, GT, 52 days CFTS - I/S - 3 years probation: Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, defendant to comply with any and all treatment prescribed by the defendant's treating mental health care professionalsCosts w/ 60 DTP or PP. Ct 2 - 90 days WCJ - Huber, GT - Concurrent with 14CF11, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.

12:06 pm cases called 14CF11 & 14CF193. Defendant Terry A. Drover in court with attorney Rebecca C. Castonia.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over matter pending. Court goes over hearing today and bond modification. Statement by Attorney Castonia regarding bond in another courts jurisdiction. Court makes a statement regarding bond modification-will not modify bond at this time for reasons stated on the record. Statement by Attorney Castonia regarding global resolution.
from Atty Castonia requesting a copy of the amended bond conditions
Bail/bond hearing on December 22, 2014 at 12:00 pm.

1:19 pm case called. 14CF11 & 14CF193. Attorney Rebecca C. Castonia in court.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over request by Attorney Castonia and makes statement to counsel. Statement by Attorney Castonia. Statement by representative from veterans benefits. Further statement by Attorney Castonia. Discussion between court, counsel and veterans admissions. Statement by Court regarding modification of bond at a date to be determined at a hearing when defendant is present.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 12:00 pm.
from Atty Castonia Re: Treatment Program Update and Request for TSC
CCAP record of DE's new charges given to the court by DA Blader at the December 1, 2014 hearing
from Department of Veterans Affairs given to the court by Atty Castonia at the December 1, 2014 hearing
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Not to be in the possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription as to the medication and proper quantity. The bond will be reverted from a $10000 Cash Bond to a $10000 Sig Bond upon written confirmation that the defendant has been accepted into the Tomah VA Medical Center Dual Diagnosis Program. The defendant may only be transported directly from the Waushara County Jail to the VA Medical Center in Thoma by his son Jason Johnson. Upon completion of the Dual Diagnosis Program the bond will be reverted back to a $10,000 Cash Bond and the defendant must immediately be transported back to the Waushara County Jail by his son Jason Johnson. If the defendant leaves the premises of the VA Hospital without authorization or is discharged from the Dual Diagnosis Program before successful discharge, the bond will immediately be converted to a $10,000 cash bond.

14CF11 & 14CF193 Cases called @ 2:40 p.m. Defendant Terry A. Drover in court with attorney Rebecca C. Castonia.  Defendant Terry A. Drover in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF193 - Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. The court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. Court orders $10,000 Cash Bond. The court will permit modification from a $10000 Cash Bond to a $10000 Sig Bond solely on the condition that the defendant is accepted in the Dual Diagnosis Program at the Thoma VA. Statement by DA Blader regarding bond and the defendant entering treatment. Statement by Atty Castonia regarding bond.  P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
